title: Compiler blows up at a switch on a struct initialization.
body:
This works nicely: http://play.golang.org/p/DgB7G3g0LB

OTOH this blows up: http://play.golang.org/p/Z_ceHAaOU2 
  prog.go:10: syntax error: unexpected name, expecting case or default or }

Is this by design? Seems weird to not be able to instantiate a struct in a switch statement.
